review.reviewBody: I've tried way too many different handlebars on my two current bikes, but I'm glad I landed on this FSA Gradient bar in the 35mm clamp, 40mm rise. This bar is on my DH bike right now, replacing a OneUp Carbon. I had no complaints with the old bar, but I decided that I don't want to run the risk anymore with carbon bars at real DH/bike park speeds. The FSA has a shape similar to the OneUp, with those ovalized sections in the bend areas to give them a certain amount of flex or compliance. I can pretty confidently say that this works. It has the same precise feel in terms of steering and control, but I'm not getting any arm pump even on long laps. The bend angles looked to be more than what was claimed, but I found a roll position that feels really good. The center section between the bends is quite wide, so cutting them down may be an issue depending on how you position your brake/shifter clamps. I like my Code brakes quite a bit inboard so that the lever tips fall right under my index fingers, and after cutting these down to about 765mm, I was pretty close to the limit. At the current sale price, it undercuts even the OneUp Alloy bar, so that was what made me choose the FSA.
review.name: My new favorite handlebar!

review.reviewBody: Glossy black with textured ends very attractive very happy with it!
review.name: 40mm rise great bar

name: Gradient MTB Handlebar

review.itemreviewed: Otero Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the Otero fleece once I sized down. Usually, I wear a medium for comfort but the small Otero fits me better. It's highly breathable, has great length, and functional thumbholes. The hood fits loose which I don't mind. This fleece does great in the washing machine and dryer with no pilling, lint collection or shrinkage. I live in northern California and usually wear it at home if it's not too cold and out hiking. If it's cold, I wear it as a mid-layer. After comparing the Otero fleece with Patagonia's R1 air fleece, I prefer the Otero fleece for fit, style and function.
review.name: Otero fleece. . . great for active or casual wear

review.itemreviewed: Otero Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Otero Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.name: Otero Fleece is awesome!

review.itemreviewed: Otero Fleece Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm really happy with the Otero fleece! It's warm, but thin enough to layer, perfect on its own for hiking in mild weather, but also perfect to layer under a heavier outer layer. It's so comfortable, and I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the hand warmer pockets are fleece lined too! I'm 5'4, 115lbs and got a small, which allows room underneath for a base layer and a vest.
review.name: Awesome jacket!

review.reviewBody: We live in the PNW so having water resistance is important. These are comfortable and waterproof in most raining conditions. They aren‚Äôt a rain boot and will eventually soak through walking through deep puddles, but still such a solid shoe. I wish you guys would restock so we could get another pair!
review.name: These shoes are awesome for my son

review.reviewBody: Perfect kids shoe for fall and winter in the PNW! And looks sharp too.
review.name: Kid is kickin it in style and staying dry and comfy

review.reviewBody: They were wide which fit my son's feet well. He found them comfortable. However, I'd say the water resistance and traction were lacking. His feet got wet pretty quickly, and he lost traction and slipped several times on our trip.
review.name: Not very water resistant

review.reviewBody: My daughter complained her feet were wet not long into our hike
review.name: Wet feet

review.reviewBody: These have been a great purchase for us! We got them for wet days in the forest in the PNW as an alternative to regular boots so he could have a bit more ease running, jumping and climbing. So far so good!
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Got these for my 10 year old grandson. He wears them constantly. He is a Bogs fan!
review.name: Comfy & tough!

review.reviewBody: This is our 3rd pair as little feet continue to grow. What a wonderful, sturdy, comfortable shoe!
review.name: It's a keeper

review.reviewBody: I have ordered these for two grandsons last year and they are the best at being comfortable, durable, easy on and off without falling off. Bogs meets a need like no other shoes on the market especially for wide feet with high instep. Thank you Bogs, we appreciate it!
review.name: Durable. Supportive, go anywhere

review.reviewBody: We love these. My son thinks they are super comfortable and they lasted an entire school year. It was supposed to be in the class. The fact that they are also waterproof is perfect. I just wish they were offered in more colors! My 5-year-old daughter only wants shoes that have pink but I would love to buy them for her too.
review.name: Comfortable and very durable.

review.reviewBody: These are comfortable and durable. Excellent shoes for kids. I also love that they are water resistant. My son wore them practically every day of the school year and they are still in great condition. I only wish they were offered in more colors!
review.name: We love these

name: Skyline Kicker Mid Shoe - Kids'

review.reviewBody: This jersey is very light and thin. It breathes great. I sized up one size and it fits great. I think it fits true to  size, but I don‚Äôt like how it would look on.
review.name: Great jersey for indoor cycling

review.reviewBody:
Until I saw this, it never occurred to me to wear anything other than a T-shirt on the trainer.   As the other reviewer says, it's great not to have to pull off a dripping wet T-shirt over my head post-workout.  And the rear pockets are handy for energy bars during longer sessions. 

It seemed pricey until I realized: (a) T-shirts are much more expensive than they used to be, and (b) this was on sale at a nice discount.

Have used it for a couple of trainer sessions, very comfy.  As usual for Castelli, XL fits me well.  Although it seems to be made longer in the torso than the other XL SS Castelli jerseys I own.  So the elastic hem at the bottom rolls up, a minor annoyance which does not happen with my other Castelli kit.  Maybe a wider elastic strip or a shorter design?
review.name: Great except bottom hem rolls up (on me)

review.reviewBody: Great jersey for indoor training. Fits well, feels good, looks nice. Might help you zwift slightly faster.
review.name: Feels good, looks nice

name: Insider Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great price for a cold weather jacket. It's well layered with insulation zippers to make it more breathable if need be. It runs a little bigger than expected, but can be adjusted to fit. Really like everything about it.
review.name: Fashionable and Functional

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and warm on the mountain. Pit zips and side zipper work great for managing heat. Kept out snow and ice well with the adjustable fit around the waist. It has a bit of an oversized fit that isn‚Äôt my favorite. Good shell layer for resort skiing or snowboarding but wouldn‚Äôt necessarily recommend for backcountry  applications.

Very nice piece of kit. As always very good quality and materials used. 4 star due to fit, ordered a large and fit slightly larger than I anticipated. Will be sweet while carving up the hill once the snow comes back.
review.name: Snowcrew anorak

review.reviewBody: Got this jacket on the cheap during a sale, brown and blue. By far best ski jacket I‚Äôve ever had. Ample pockets, very warm, used the armpit vents a lot even below freezing. Got tons of compliments
review.name: Warm and waterproof

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket in January 2024 as my current ski jacket was getting old and was letting in water every-time I went skiing. I primarily ski at Whistler, BC and therefore require a good waterproof jacket due to the wet conditions. This jacket has a lot of awesome features (eg. the double kangaroo pouch on the front is perfect for accessing your phone, wallet, keys etc. quickly) and has good ventilation. After skiing with this jacket for 3 months now in a variety of conditions, I would say the following: - It is warm not the warmest, but it's perfect for anywhere from 0 degrees all the way down to -20 (so long as you have good layers underneath too). - Waterproofing is good, not great. I have gotten wet with the jacket on a few times now in wet snow conditions which was very disappointing. This is the biggest drawback I would say. I spent the money on this coat, looking for quality and it just doesn't quite hold up in wet conditions. I have treated it with waterproofing Nikwax, so I am hopeful this will improve the waterproofness, however a jacket this expensive that claims to be waterproof, should be able to protect you from wet snow. - Fits nicely and looks great - this was at the bottom of my priority list but is a definite plus with this jacket - Has an awesome hood which easily fits over your helmet on wet/windy days. - Zippers are a bit niggly and can be easy to snag/catch on material due to their size. Would have made these larger and more durable in my opinion.
review.name: Solid jacket - Waterproofing Could Be Better

review.reviewBody: I love how comfortable and warm the Anorak keeps me. As well as the fact that it has a large kangaroo zippered pouch, and then the higher pouch on the chest. It's also really convenient for the side zips to open so when I get warm, I can open them a little bit to cool me off. I just wish the Anorak had a designated ski lift pass pocket. I tend to keep it in the higher chest pouch, but it does seem to move around and then I have to take out the pass itself and scan it.
review.name: Wish it had a lift pass pocket

review.reviewBody: I was a bit thrown off at first by the "pull-over" style of the jacket, however the side zipper allows you to get it on quite easily. Once on, the rubberized inner layer does an excellent job keeping snow out and keeping you dry (I have fallen in a few huge powder bowls with this coat on already, and stayed completely dry underneath). I was also worried about the waterproofing of the jacket, as many companies claim that their clothes are waterproof, but in actuality, you still get soaked if you use them for any length of time in outdoor activities. Luckily, this Anorak jacket performs as it claims. The water beads off of it, and the under-arm zips allow you to breath and vent heat when you are skiing hard. Finally, I love the little kangaroo pocket, with the fleece lining. It's an awesome spot to warm up your hands and is super comfy. This jacket definitely exceeded my expectations. Well done OR!
review.name: Love my new Ski Jacket

review.reviewBody: Ended up loving this jacket more than originally anticipated. Super warm and actually feels like a puffy with a wind layer over the top. I'm 200 lbs 6 ft and got a large which fits great with extra room
review.name: Great & cozy

name: Snowcrew Anorak - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have a Gregory 28L and love it for my day hikes. I needed a new backpacking bag and decided to stick with Gregory and glad I did.  Very comfortable, good support, nice placement on pockets and straps.  Side zipper to access the length of the bag is nice.

I want to start by saying that I am a loyal Gregory Backpack user.  I just purchased this bag so that my sister could use my old one to try backpacking. The new hip belt design is great and the adaptability is amazing as always. My one issue is that the raincover that came with the bag is ridiculous and pretty much useless.  It doesn't even cover the whole bag with it full, and there is no way you could fit a tent in too if it's strapped to the bottom of your pack. I couldn't even get the strap clipped. Like why even bother including it guys! If you are purchasing this bag because it comes with the raincover, you'll be disappointed. You're gonna have to buy a raincover.
review.name: Great bag, useless raincover

review.reviewBody: I got this hike for an eight day backpacking trip and had no issues stowing all my gear in an organized way. The extra functions of the sunglass strap, external pocket straps, and the water bottle stash pocket were awesome. I was surprised that the S-M was the right size for me at 5'10" - it's very easily adjustable on the fly. The hip straps and pockets made it a very comfortable carry. I loved that the rain fly was included. Only feedback was the waist pockets are large but not large enough for a iPhone max but honestly unless I'm taking photos I don't really want my phone around that much anyway!
review.name: Best Pack for Women's Multi Day Hiking

review.reviewBody: This pack worked great for me on a recent four day backpacking trip. I didn't have the fanciest/smallest/lightest gear, so the extra room was useful to bring everything I needed. I love how customizable the fit is, though it was hard to get it dialed in at first. This pack comes with a rain cover that worked pretty well too - I hiked in a downpour for 10 miles, and the rain cover paired with a cheap poncho kept everything inside pretty dry.

I spent a long time not buying Gregory due to some bad packs in my youth.  But the Maven has been great.  Lots of space (although, it seems smaller than its 65 advertised size).  Plenty of expansion, room for gear, extra pockets, accessible water bottles and other extras.  My only knock is the adjustable frame seems a little off.  We have the harness buried behind the back padding and it‚Äôs still a bit too tall.  It‚Äôs supposed to be about a 15‚Äì16 measured multiple times, and we have it down to where it‚Äôs a 14 on the Gregory scale and we‚Äôre still not getting great harness angels.
review.name: Great Pack!

review.reviewBody: Love the lightweight comfortable fit and pockets during my backpacking trip
Very comfortable to wear! I have used it on a few day hikes with full gear while training for my first solo overnight trip and of course it worked perfectly for my solo trip

I bought this backpack to handle more weight for when I carry 'family' gear on our backpacking trips. I had this pack with 48 lbs (I am 5'2" and 130 lbs) for a family backpack trip at Picture Rocks, MI. Due to our daughter being young and not able to carry as much, I needed a backpack that could take on all of my items plus many of my daughters. While 48 lbs was heavy, this pack was as comfortable as possible with the extra weight.
review.name: Can carry a load!

review.reviewBody: Love this pack! Lots of compartments, comfortable, and fits my small body well.
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody: The side entry pocket is nice, but it would be better to have a full U or J zip to access more of the inside of the bag. Other than that the pack is awesome, packed full of features and very affordable!
review.name: Great Pack for the price, full of features

review.reviewBody: Arch support is great, soles are soft but responsive. I wear a 13 shoe and croc clog, but my foot fit into an 11. I got 11's and 12's just in case, and 12s were still really big. Try these on in store if you can. Very solid one size is taken care of.
review.name: Feel great but seriously size down

review.reviewBody: The Pink Clay looks so much different online than in person. It arrived to my house and it's more of a darker pink in person still very comfy but I was really hoping to get the exact same color as shown online. Also when you take a picture of them it looks like the picture online but truly it's not.
review.name: I would buy this again in a different color

review.reviewBody: Although these are squishy and comfy, the fit runs large. A better sure fit would help with the arch support. I don't know that I would purchase these again for the purpose of arch support alone, which was my goal this time.
review.name: Comfy but not strong arch support, run big

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of mellow slides a few months ago. Loved them. Decided to buy another pair, same size as my current pair. The pair I received today is over an inch longer than my current pair, yet marked same size. They're unwearable.
review.name: Inconsistent sizing

review.reviewBody: I've looked and looked for comfortable shoes to wear on our hardwood floors. I was having a lot of foot pain and tried everything. These are the most comfortable shoes I've ever had and tried on. Really made a huge difference and foot pain is gone.
review.name: I have 3 pairs now.

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife and she loves them. She wears them every day around the house, just constantly recovering I guess. She had some cheapo foam recovery ones that looked essentially the same and she liked them, but then I got her these and apparently they are significantly better.
review.name: These slides recovered my wife's love for me

review.reviewBody: I have purchased several different recovery slides for me and family members. We all love them, open and closed toe styles! Very comfortable and soothing on the feet!
review.name: I have bought this item several styles and colors!

review.reviewBody: I love this. I read that the sizing ran big so I did size down one size and it fits pretty good. I actually received 2 different sizes in my order but customer support was amazing and quickly dispatched a new pair.
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: Don't like these at all, my feet want to walk off the side of them. Had high hopes they would be more comfortable than my regular slides on the gravel driveway but was quickly disappointed. I tried modifying them to open up the toe are more but it didn't help. They were thrown away. I will get another pair of original slides
review.name: Don't like these

review.reviewBody: Very comfy. May not be supportive for walking 10 hr shifts.
review.name: Comfy

name: Mellow Slide

review.reviewBody: If you ride bike's you're use to discomfort, it's just part of what happens riding.  I mounted this on my bike to set it up on rollers and there is nothing comfortable about it.  I know they 3d printed this, but the padding feels like it's not there.  It's just uncomfortable and I wonder if anyone test road these before they decided to charge a high price for them.  I'm going back to my Sella SLR Kit Carbino as it just works.  Kinda sad this new saddle didn't work out, but here we are.
review.name: I wanted to like it, but I can't

review.reviewBody:
The vest is nice and comfy and I like the Stormy Mauve color (which is like a dirty/grey-ish pink).
Sizing: I'm 5'3, 110 lbs, usually XS in Patagonia. I got an S for the vest as I was looking for something that could go on top of a thicker hoodie. And the size has room and serves my purpose well. If you're looking for something on top of a thin base layer, you might want to go with your usual size.
review.name: Nice and comfy!

review.reviewBody:
I wish I could review the actual product. However, it is more about Backcountry. This is the second time I have ordered this vest, and I have not received one yet. I waited two weeks for the first order. When I went to check the status of the order, I found that Backcountry had canceled it. The frustrating thing is that I had a $40.00 coupon that had been applied to it and now I can not reuse the coupon because it said it has already been used. 

This second order has been over three weeks. It says it was shipped. The last status update was November 19th.  I emailed Backcountry last week, and I have not heard from them.
review.name: NOt recieved

review.reviewBody: This vest has fleece inside, smooth fabric outside. The shoulder is not restrained. Perfect for Golfing.
review.name: Good vest

review.reviewBody: The vest is a good fit: Snug all over and long enough to keep the lower back warm. Nice color to match my wardrobe. Good price (was on sale :)
review.name: Good Fit

review.reviewBody: My sweater vest is exactly what I hoped it would be. I received it promptly and in excellent condition.
review.name: Better Sweater Fleece Vest

review.reviewBody: This vest would best suit a woman with a long torso.  I wear petite clothes.  It was too long for me.  But it was of excellent quality.  Unfortunately, I had to return it.  I guess I don't fit Patagonia clothes - back to LL Bean and Orvis for me.
review.name: Too long

review.reviewBody: This vest is terrific! Comfortable fit; warm; great color; and, it goes with everything! I usually wear an extra small in jackets; however, I ordered a size up so that my heavier sweaters would fit under the vest more comfortably.
review.name: Patagonia Fleece Vest

review.reviewBody: This is the second Better Sweater vest I've purchased and I also have the jacket. Great weight, great fit, super comfortable. I have one in small that I use over light layers and one in medium that I use over heavier layers.
review.name: Love Patagonia's Better Sweater Fleece

review.reviewBody:
Recently wore this on a hike and it‚Äôs a great addition to my collection of Patagonia. 
In 42 degrees w/ the sun out, this vest was extremely comfortable, warm and breathable. Just wore it with a long sleeve tee and leggings and I was able to hike and not get over heated.
review.name: Warm & Comfy

review.reviewBody: Love Patagonia! Their products are such great quality and  I've had pieces by them that last 10 years plus! Bit pricey for a vest, so bought this during a holiday sale and absolutely love it. I'm 5'3", 115 lbs and a size small fit perfectly over sweaters and under my coat. I wear it in the house or as a layer when going out. Perfect piece!
review.name: Great layering piece!

name: Better Sweater Fleece Vest - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Tagalong Shelter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Amazing. Easy to transport and set up. Offers great shade. Incredible protection from rain. 10/10.
review.name: AMAZINGGGGGGG

review.reviewBody: The tagalong shelter works great for the beach. I love how compact and lightweight it is compared to traditional structured shade shelters. It holds up well in the wind just using the sandbags without needing to be staked down.
review.name: Great shade tent for the beach

review.reviewBody: Packs down small for a canopy. There is a very low side and a nice high side and the other two sides slant between the two heights. It is a little difficult to put up over a picnic table since there are ground guide lines that run the edge, which are helpful for staking distance guidelines. More designed for using camp chairs under than for shading a picnic table. Sets up like a tent without sides.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Tagalong Shelter is just what I have been searching for. It comes in an easy to transport bag that goes on your back. It is lightweight and super easy to set up. It took my wife and I about 20 minutes to get it completed. Inside of it we fit two adults with our chairs and two children as well. It help up wonderfully even with occasional wind gusts of about 10 mph. We used this shelter while camping and at the beach. I highly recommend this product!
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Taglong Shelter is made of high quality material and is very easy to setup. The provided instructions are easy to follow. I like that it is very lightweight so it is easy to bring along in the included carry bag. The sandbags are a nice add to help keep the shelter in place. The green color is attractive and the size covers a good area. The included hanging loops are a good addition to allow for hanging string lights or other items. It is easy and quick to take apart and fold back into the carry bag.
review.name: Great quality, easy to setup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We live at the beach and were looking for something to offer some good shade. This comes in a nice carrying bag and is very easy to set up and take down. I would recommend this product to anyone wanting something light and easy to take to the beach or for tailgates.
review.name: So easy to set up

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Tagalong shelter is perfect for a hot sunny day whether you're at home throwing a get together or for the beach. At first my Husband and I had difficulty putting it together but once we figured it out it was super easy. It's not tall like I would have liked but overall it kept me cool and the sun away in this Texas weather. Perfect for the beach or at home.
review.name: Perfect for keeping the sun away

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so incredibly impressed with this popup shelter ‚Äì just WOW. It is only 6lbs and everything about it was designed to make it as easy to set up and as light as possible. They literally thought of everything, and I cannot wait to take it out on our next camping trip! SO many great things here but I will try to hit the highlights. Fast ‚Äì after our first time putting up which always takes a little longer, we timed the second time after waiting a week or so. It took two people 7 minutes and 21 seconds from being in the bag to fully set up (minus staking). Take down was even faster ‚Äì 5 minutes and 28 seconds. We weren‚Äôt even trying to hurry, so I assume if we were really pushing to be fast, this could be cut down even more! Design ‚Äì everything here is fantastic! The base of the shelter is connected with webbing between all 4 corners so when you are putting it up it‚Äôs very easy to keep it together and in shape. Each corner has integrated sandbags for the beach, and on the inside of each corner a mesh pocket and D ring. There is a hook in the very center for hanging a light or a fan. The tiedown lines stay tucked away into a self-contained pocket on the outside corners of the shelter, so no tangled lines everywhere. The aluminum stakes live in their own pocket on the bag. The entire shelter packs down small and there is plenty of room in the bag when putting away. The only negative thing I could possibly say about this thing are the aluminum tent poles are extremely long and a bit unwieldly when fully assembled, but installation is a breeze, and they slide through the pole pockets easily. The shelter is a low shelter that you have to suck to get under, but my 6‚Äô1‚Äù hubby can stand up straight in the middle. But really, we will be sitting 99% of the time under the shelter so that‚Äôs not a huge deal really ‚Äì and since it‚Äôs closer to the ground there is more shade to be had. The Tagalong shelter is definitely our new go-to shelter! We are so tired of lugging around giant heavy canopies that take up so much space. Way to go Eureka!
review.name: Fantastic Lightweight Shelter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this tagalong shelter for when my family goes camping. It‚Äôs so easy to put together together. I love that it comes in a portable bag that you can carry everything in it and it‚Äôs not heavy like a normal pop up tent. Would definitely get another to take camping!
review.name: Great coverage

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Tagalong shelter is very easy to take on-the-go for instant shade anywhere. The shelter comes in a backpack style carrying bag so its very easy for me to take with, even when I have other things to carry. It is lightweight yet durable when in use. I find it very easy to set up and take down. It stays put even on a windy day. I am so happy to have this shelter to enjoy a nice sunny day without getting sunburned.
review.name: Excellent shade!

name: Tagalong Shelter

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have no issues with these mesh storage bags. We are sending them to camp with my daughter and I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll be out to good use. They are obviously high quality - you can tell by the stitching and thickness of the material. 

They‚Äôre smaller than I thought they would be, but that‚Äôs my own fault for not looking at the sizes.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These mesh stuff sack set from Sea to summit are a must have for every trip. Comes in a pack of 3 different sizes. Holds wet items with ease, no dripping or anything! Throw them in the washer and your done. Durable and is flexible to fit a lot of items in them. Highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These stuff sacks make it quick and easy to identify the contents and get what you are looking for rather than open and dig through a sack only to find that you stashed the item in another sack.They are tough and resilient, but probably not as durable as the standard sack, and prone to catch on rough surfaces or protruding objects. They are a little pricey, but a nice functional and convenient addition to my pack. If, like me, you sometimes forget where you stuffed your stuff, these are a handy piece of gear.

review.reviewBody:
Was excited to receive my Freestyle vest today until I opened the box and saw the color! The color is definitely not as pictured. I talked with Canada Goose and they admitted the color was ¬∞Photoshopped on their site, which appears to be the case for Backcountry as well. See the attached photo. It?s definitely the color on the right.

Outside of the color, the vest fits nicely and appears to be well-made. I like the front cargo¬∞¬∞ pockets to stash a pocket knife or cell phone in. The hand pockets are not very deep with the palm of my hands hanging out. Can definitely see getting many years of use out of it. 

Really liked the military green shown on the site, but may return it and go with an Arcteryx Cerium LT vest. I have the hoody in a size large and would get the same for the vest based on my experience with the hoody.
review.name: Military Green not as pictured!

review.reviewBody:
This helmet has decent cooling and looks fantastic!!
Unfortunately, you (still) can't get replacement lenses... It also wants to slide down your head however tight/loose you have it causing the lens to rub your nose (using electrical tape for padding). The adhesive that holds the felt'ish pads near your ears have been failing as well.. so if your ok with customizing this helmet, it's great! But out of the box needs some work, and hope you don't damage your lens.!
Despite the issues, I still rave about this helmet to anyone that asks.

review.reviewBody: Thus far I wore the helmet once. It was during an IM 70.3 and it was pouring rain. The fit is nice and aero but the magnet that connects the visor to the helmet is NOT strong enough. It was pouring and my visor was totally fogged up and I couldn't see anything. I was trying to get my fingers in the inside to wipe away the fog and pop, the visor flew off. Totally bummed and devastated. So buyer beware as I don't even see replacement lenses on the site.
review.name: Good but....

review.reviewBody: Although sleek and a nicely designed aero helmet (that is comfortable and light) I do not like the new design. I was a HUGE fan of the former Podium TT design and was much looking forward to some similarities, but there were none. What I favored most in the previous design was a much more rounded edge at the back vs that elongated "aero" point at the back. In my opinion the Jetstream's material felt almost too light, sort of thin and flimsy. I wanted to like this one a lot but I guess I just miss my Podium TT. Will definitely still rock it at races and rep the SMITH brand though. Thanks for this opportunity to share.

review.reviewBody: I got these for ski touring, chilly bike commutes or rides, and general winter weather. My hands run really cold so these are great for me down to about 30F, maybe 25F if I'm putting out a harder effort. I like the velcro wrist adjustment and slightly long wrists to keep snow and cold air out. My only complaints are that they fit a bit snuggly for the size, yet the thumb is too long (and I have long fingers). I usually fit well in a M, which is what I ordered here. Great quality construction though!
review.name: Great glove, warm, fits snuggly

review.reviewBody: These gloves are exactly what I'd hoped for. Warm and protective against the wind without being bulky ski gloves, I love the leather palm. The loop to pull them on is super durable.
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: I tried many gloves for ice climbing in Qu√©bec and never found the right fit. The fingers and always too long (specially the thumbs) and the extra material gets stock in the carabiner or the ice screw handle when i lead. Those gloves have smaller length of fingers and finally i feel confident with gloves. The warmness is fairly good, as long as the gloves aren't wet and i use warm mitains for belaying. I only put a 4 stars as i'm not sure about durability. It's already getting a bit damage after a season. Would recommend it with no hesitation for small hands and i will buy another pair next season
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: Super warm gloves for backcountry adventures. Keeps my hands warm but still allows for some dexterity. I little big but not too big for my almost kid size hands. I got the women's small.
review.name: Warm Backcountry Gloves

review.reviewBody: I have been searching for years for a pair of gloves that fits well, is warm and has good dexterity. I am so happy with these gloves.
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody: I'll admit, I abused these a bit. I did some brush and timber clearing with them in 20 weather. I was really surprised that did great! And they kept my hands super warm.
review.name: Warm and tough

review.reviewBody: These gloves were a good size for my small hands. I have kid size hands and I ordered the small in the women's version. They were still just slightly too long but still totally wearable. I like the material. They feel super well made. They have a good balance of dexterity and protection/warmth. I ended up sending them back and getting the heated version of these to make them even more capable in all weather situations.
review.name: Great Backcountry Gloves

review.reviewBody: Excellent warmth-to-dexterity or warmth-to-weight ratio. I like that it is not too puffy and my digits are pretty flexible and the cuffs can be tucked underneath my sleeves as long as your sleeves aren't too tight.
review.name: Very warm

review.reviewBody: Thinner then I expected for the warmth rating, but seems to hold up well.
review.name: Fits well.

review.reviewBody: These were exactly what I was looking for! Not too bulky so I can still use my fingers, water resistant so I can throw snow balls for my puppy, and warm enough to keep my hands toasty during all my adventures. I've got longer fingers and they fit a little bit small in that regard, but it's a minor issue and doesn't bother me for the most part.
review.name: Just what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: These are great boots. I had to send the 13s back and replace them with 14s. 13s were too snug on my feet. I would give the boots a 5 star rating except that they slipped badly on rocks where we were fishing in NZ. Wish the Simms folks had pushed their cleats more before I purchased. As is, I fell in the river twice, got soaked both times, ruined my cell phone, but lord did we catch fish.  If you are going to NZ, get the cleats and put them on your boots, save getting wet.
Product has been as advertised, I‚Äôm very happy with my purchase. I‚Äôve only had and used the product for 1 month tho so far. So cannot give 5 stars.
review.name: Very good product

review.reviewBody: The best wadding boot I‚Äôve owned including felt. Colorado , Roaring Fork and Frying Pan are my home waters all three are slick rivers to wade these boots are outstanding. Thanks folks well done!
review.name: Great wadding boots

review.reviewBody: These boots are phenomenal!  They are incredibly light, extremely comfortable, and the soles are remarkably effective on wet slippery rocks.  I bought them primarily as a travel boot, but I have used them a bunch this winter in Montana and have really enjoyed the easy mobility they provide and the hold they allow on river bottoms.  They have become my go-to boot, displacing a bunch of far burlier boots.  Give them a try ...
review.name: Outstanding boots!

review.reviewBody:
Good thing on this boots is that they are very comfortable and light.
But the grip is just horrible. Other then on dry rocks they are just slippery as hell. 
Did add studs and grip was a little better but because of the soft Vibram they don‚Äòt stay in the boots very long. 
Very disappointed as they were not cheap. Won‚Äòt use this boots again.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Thank goodness! A super light weight bomber boot for the traveling angler!

review.reviewBody: In 20 degrees and being outside for 10min my fingers were frozen. I wanted to love these. I read other reviews saying it worked in similar temps but definitely didn't for me unfortunately.
review.name: I was so excited to get these

review.reviewBody: I love these gloves, they are so warm! I use them on their own hiking while splitboarding and as a liner for really cold days in the resort. The Small size fit my small hands very well... I have borderline kid size hands and they still fit me pretty well. I was able to use my phone with the gloves on my hands. Highly recommended if you want warm hands!
review.name: Super Warm Gloves

review.reviewBody: These are nice sturdy, every day kind of gloves, but they fit a little big. I usually wear a women's medium but wish I had gone a size smaller.
review.name: Good, but fit a little big.

review.reviewBody: Terrible. The gloves fell apart on the first use. This is the 1st time I purchased an OR product, relying entirely on their reputation and I can say with confidence OR will never be considered again as an apparel provider.
review.name: Fell apart on first use

review.reviewBody: This gloves are awesome for all things outdoors. They fit snuggly and keep my hands warm so I can do all things fun in the snow.
review.name: Love the glove

review.reviewBody: I was expecting those gloves to be good, but they absolutely exceeded my expectations. The first time I wore them, I was outside for six hours in steady rain and near-freezing temperatures. My hands were the driest part of me. Not that these are waterproof- they aren't- but the grid fleece on the backs of the hands wicks and breathes so well that my body heat dried the gloves faster than they could get wet. My hands stayed warm and dry, and the fingers were still dextrous enough that I could work outside. Love these and will be buying more, plus anything else made of Vigor Plus fleece that I can get my hands on. Big improvement in fit over the previous year's model as well.
review.name: My new absolute favourite gloves

review.reviewBody:
I was very hesitant to get a stretch down jacket but went with MH because I believe in their quality. Good choice. I was sold on the high hip because I ride horses and need a shorter jacket.
I got this jacket on sale and it was a great buy. I got a large as that was the only one left and I can layer underneath. Good looking jacket. Right Choice. 
FYI I am a 38" bust by tape with a tee shirt and and 39" hip. Hope this helps.
review.name: Oh Yeah.

review.reviewBody: I was really excited about this jacket for the high hip component but it didn‚Äôt fit as expected (actually sat at a regular length for me ‚Äî I‚Äôm 5‚Äô4‚Äù) and I didn‚Äôt find it warm enough to justify the price. I returned it.
review.name: Not worth the cost

review.reviewBody: Very nice fitting jacket and high quality. The sleeves just a tad long but all Mountain Hardware jacket sleeves fit me that way. I wish the color was more of a true mustard, but otherwise it's a great looking jacket. I knocked off one star because the fabric is "noisy" and not as soft to the touch as Patagonia's down sweater either.
review.name: Warm Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket.  It is extremely lightweight and soft, yet very warm.  The neck fits just right to keep your neck warm.  High-Hip height allows for great movemnt.  I am 5'3", 115lbs and the XS fits perfectly with enough room to layer underneath.
review.name: Great Jacket

name: Stretchdown High-Hip Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have a handful of bike shorts from Patagonia, Yeti, REI and these. Of them, these are my least favorite. The material is solid and seems like it will hold up well. It's also pretty stretchy so easy to ride it. The fit is a bit odd - they run bigger than other shorts I have (both bike and non-bike shorts), in terms of waste, hips, and length. They look a bit like shorts from 1996 in that regard. As well, the phone pocket is poorly placed. If you put your phone in it while riding it will restrict your pedal stroke and/or flop around on you. I have other shorts, such as the Patagonia Dirt Craft, which have a much better 3rd pocket design. I got these shorts on sale so it was probably worth it, but I'd recommend looking elsewhere before these.
review.name: Meh - not in love

review.reviewBody: Nice, basic short that can be used for riding or casual wearing. Belt loops are a plus as velcro adjusters just don't help with keeping shorts in place. Very thin/light weight material will be great during hot weather but prolly won't last if I take a digger or two (I try to stay upright as much as possible). Nice color, good fit (slim not baggy).
review.name: Nice, basic short

name: Arc Short - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Road, Tri, and CX Bike Cover
review.reviewBody: The quality of the bag is superb, for the intended use: protect your bike from the elements while it is in your bike rack. However, I had to send it back. Although the manufacturer's packaging, and CC's spec's in the item listing, say it will fit most bikes 48 to 63 cm, that is not true. I have a 58 cm Trek Checkpoint with 38c tires and a 58 cm Trek Emonda SLR, both with 42 cm wide handlebars, and the bag won't fit either bike. I could barely get the cover over the handlebars (the "box" for the handlebars had to be really stretched to get it over the bars) and the tight fit kept triggering the Di2 shifters while trying to fit the bag on the bike and, once the bars were covered, trying to fit the rest of the bag over the rest of the bike. Bars wider than 42 cm, I doubt getting it over them. Once I got the bars covered, the front wheel area was big enough to easily fit and I could zip the bag easily from the front wheel to the chainrings. I struggled to get the saddle in and then, well, forget getting the rear wheel in - the bag just will not fit over the rear wheel, either bike. In fact, my wife has a 50 cm Checkpoint and her wheelbase is only an inch or so shorter than mine and I know the bag would not even be large enough for her bike. The stretching required would surely rip seams and perhaps the zipper. So beware - you better have a small bike. Sorry, but better/more accurate size spec's are needed.
review.name: Great Product...if it fits!

review.itemreviewed: Road, Tri, and CX Bike Cover
review.reviewBody:
The Zealpro bags are the real deal. I have both the road/gravel bags and the MTN bag. My bikes live on the rear of my expedition truck & are exposed to the sun, mud, dirt, road debris & all the other harsh elements as I travel across the globe. They have been on there 2 years and are still going strong. 

As an added benefit they conceal the bike from any potential thieves that I may encounter as I journey 220,000 miles around the world. 

The bags are built super tough, zippers are strong and virtually nothing gets inside the indestructible fabric.  Mine are attached to 1Up mounts and work perfectly- as well as protecting the bikes from the mount itself.

Tens of thousands of miles logged and could not be happier.
review.name: The ONLY Bike Bag You Need To Buy

review.itemreviewed: Road, Tri, and CX Bike Cover
review.reviewBody: I have been using their latest generation of cover (road) since they launched it in 2019 and have loved it.  I bought the MTB cover earlier this year when it launched and love it too.  You can tell that a lot of engineering went into the cover and it's overbuilt.  The rubber-like backing on the cover protects the bike from abrasion and water penetrating the cover.  The light kit is a great idea too as the cover will block most tail lights.
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Road, Tri, and CX Bike Cover
review.reviewBody: Was using this bike bag for a cross country road trip for my new mountain bike. The product description describes the interior as being non-abrasive, but it has rubbed the paint in spot and ruined the paint.
review.name: Ruined the Paint on my mountain bike

name: Road, Tri, and CX Bike Cover

review.itemreviewed: Chilkat V Lace WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had to wait until it rained in order to give a review about these amazing water proof boots, I'm so glad that I took a gamble with them because they look work & fit like a glove. I proud to give them a rating on a scale of 1-10 a 10 thank you The North Face for making great products.

review.itemreviewed: Chilkat V Lace WP Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Chilkat V Lace WP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently purchased the Men's Chilkat V Lace Waterproof Boots, and I am thoroughly impressed with their performance. These boots seamlessly blend style, comfort, and functionality. The waterproof feature is a game-changer, keeping my feet dry even in challenging weather conditions. The lace-up design provides a secure and adjustable fit, ensuring maximum comfort during extended wear. What stands out the most is the durability of these boots. The quality craftsmanship and robust materials make them a reliable choice for various outdoor activities. Whether trekking through wet terrain or navigating icy paths, these boots have proven to be up to the task. Moreover, the insulation keeps my feet warm in colder temperatures without compromising breathability. The traction on the outsole provides excellent grip, adding an extra layer of confidence in every step. Overall, the Men's Chilkat V Lace Waterproof Boots have exceeded my expectations. They not only meet the demands of outdoor adventures but also do so with a touch of style. I highly recommend these boots for anyone seeking a reliable and stylish footwear option.
review.name: Amazing!

name: Chilkat V Lace WP Boot - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Ski Sleeve online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these knowing full well there would be no padding. I also purchased them on sale, so the price was reasonable. For the sale price and my expectation, they did the job. I bought 2 of these so that we could take our skis from our car up to the lodge without having to awkwardly carry them, and the bags worked perfectly. The quality seems to be good (only used 2 days so far) and the colors are nice! I would recommend these if you need an easy transport bag. Absolutely do not expect to use these on a plane, your skis will get messed up.
review.name: Did The Job

review.reviewBody: Works great. Material feels nice and high quality plus the fun pattern made it easy to find. Kept my skis organized and safe throughout a cross country trip, a week on the mountain, and back again.
review.name: Great ski bag

review.reviewBody: Awesome price for the bag. In the PNW I don't have ski racks on my roof rack because I interchange my surf board and ski gear. This bag makes it easy to transport and strap down my skis and poles that fit in them. Worried about how cheap the bag was but its held up well and is everything you need. If I was shipping my skis maybe I'd go with a harder case, but for everyday use it is great.
review.name: Bang for your buck

name: Ski Sleeve

review.reviewBody: These booties are comfy, stylish, and fit my wide feet. I can walk all day in them without discomfort. So with the price.
review.name: So walkable.

review.reviewBody: I'm loving these new Ugg styles! I didn't purchase any for awhile, because I have 4 other pairs to sustain me...I thought! Nope! I'm in it again! These cuties sucked me in! I am a mid-50's woman who is on her feet a lot throughout the day teaching elementary aged children. I needed something sturdy, comfortable, and "current". These fit the bill! I originally ordered an 8, but had to return for a 7 1/2. They are very comfortable, but unlike my other Ugg shoes/boots, they don't have the warm fleece lining. That's ok...I've got several other pairs to check off that box. The Citifunc Zip looks awesome with leggings, skinny jeans, straight cut jeans, and flared. I recommend them highly to go with ALL of your looks!
review.name: Ugg purchase #2 in 1 month

review.reviewBody: I'm loving this new style! I'm an old school Ugg wearer from the mid aughts, and still love them. But...this is a COOL, updated shape. It doesn't have the warm fleece lining inside, but I still think it will be a warm boot. I was looking for an on-trend, platform, comfortable boot, and this seems like it will fit the bill. I am having to return for a 1/2 size smaller because even though I tried on my usual 8 with thick socks, my ankle/heel still rode up each time I took a step, which wasn't the ultimate in comfort. Can't wait to get them!!
review.name: Back on the Ugg train

review.reviewBody:
This boot has good traction for a wading boot. They are reasonably light.
They are stiff initially in the heel collar but soften up, they have minimal padding. The eyelets are not reinforced, probably to save weight, and the loops of webbing used create significant friction on the lace and eyelet itself, causing premature wear. We typically break the laces and tear the eyelets out before the boot fails. We get about 150 days on the water before these boots need to be replaced. They seem overpriced but are lightweight.
review.name: Bad lacing, light weight

review.reviewBody: After running the Mens fly weights since they came out loving them and walking them into ground  I updated my gear at the start of the season only to be Super disappointed in the womens boot. When i put them on they fit great and were super comfortable but as soon as i stepped in the river i felt like  there was no ankle support! I realised that unlike the men‚Äôs boot the womens have a deep V cut into pull tab/ archilles area meaning you lose ALOT of ankle support. Really unsure why they‚Äôve done this? Will be going back to the men‚Äôs boot next time.
review.name: Where‚Äôs the ankle support gone?

review.reviewBody:
The boots are terrific.  Lightweight yet rugged.  And finally laces that only need a tiny tug to snug up the laces.

For future reference, I do wish there were a few more places for studs in each boot.  Sill a fabulous bot.
review.name: W's Flyweight Vibram Wading Boot

review.reviewBody:
Great fit on this women's sized wade boot.
I did, as suggested purchase one size up from my street shoe size to accommodate the neo bootie on my waders.
review.name: GREAT Boots women's sizing

review.reviewBody: I needed a pair of non-felt-bottom wading boots for a New Zealand trip and the first pair I ordered were too large. The replacements came quickly, but without enough time to break them in before the trip. Not a problem at all ‚Äì I put my flyweights on brand new with a pair of neoprene socks and was perfectly comfortable from the get-go, hiking miles through rocky riverbeds, crossing rivers all day long, wet-wading in total comfort. A fantastic product.
review.name: Crazy comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for wet wading. With most wading boots, I really struggle to find something that‚Äôs comfortable for the kinds of miles I hike to a fishing spot, then the duration of my fishing, too. Others either don‚Äôt offer any support, are too clunky, or too heavy. These have finally solved all my problems!!!! They fit so well and feel like a good pair of hiking boots. The vibram soles are also a game changer. My favorite wading boots to date! For wet wading, I ordered my typical boot size and they fit well with wading socks.

I bought these boots in Wasilla, Alaska in 2020.  I love the fit and comfort.  I would give them five stars except the traction knobs on the bottom of the boots are peeling off.  I noticed on a trip last summer.  I use these boots 3 weeks each year in Alaska.  At least half of the time is via drift boat or raft.  The rivers and creeks that I fish are not rough on boots.  The uppers look brand new. I've been trying to submit a repair claim but not sure it's working because there is no way to know if my pictures are actually being added the the request.
review.name: Great Boots except

review.reviewBody: Love these boots! Much lighter than my last pair and fit perfectly.
Great quality. Light weight. East to move around in. Would recommend these over more cumbersome shoes.
Great product. Walked 12 miles and they didn‚Äôt feel clunky. Also, they‚Äôre quick to dry!
review.name: Light weight wading boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] No odor after 3 days of use in hot/cold/humid Alabama hunting weather. I hanged the top and bottom in bathroom inside out and used for 3 days of hunting. No odor! Soft and warm.
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great to use under pants to bike my kid to school or walk to the grocery store. Holds up well after washing. Great moisture wicking properties for active wearers.
review.name: Great base layer for Midwest winter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] great product. I used it to ski in mountain. Feels good
review.name: Great for ski

review.reviewBody: I bought these a month ago and have used a handful of times. I bought them to replace an old pair of SmartWools. Fabric quality is good but the waist band is awful. The old Smartwool waist band never rolled the new ones roll every time. I‚Äôll buy SmartWool next time.
review.name: Dissappointed

review.reviewBody: Bought for Fiance and they are light but very warm !
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Icebreaker baselayers are the best, I always get them. These are predictably great, comfy and super warm without being hot indoors. My only complaint is the waistband.... it rolled up immediately when I put these on and stayed rolled forever. I'm petite and they fit me, and this has never happened with any icebreaker leggings of mine in the past. Did they make the waistband out of a new material? Is it less wide than it used to be? Not sure, but I would really love it to be thicker/wider and stay put, because the rolled waistband gets really uncomfortable fast. I would also love to see these come in shorter lengths and XS sizing. Otherwise, they're amazing.
review.name: amazing except for the waistband

review.reviewBody: The 260 is great for those 0F days whether on the lift or going for a skin or hike. I like wear these when I sit by the fire on a hut trip. All my Icebreaker clothing is top notch. I've been able to use a regular wash with a low heat dry setting and have no shrinking or issues. No itch fabric. The fabric wicks and dries quickly
review.name: Warm and Cozy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for a base layer for backcountry skiing and am thrilled with them. Great warmth, excellent fit, and the high-quality wool I've come to expect from Icebreaker. Simply the best.
review.name: Best leggings yet

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I did some work at 6500 to 7500 feet in SE Idaho in March. The temperatures were from 30-50. These were perfect. I typically am more sensitive to cold than the average person.
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody: I'm ordered these this summer to alleviate my plantars facitius pain. It worked and I wear them on warm days.

review.reviewBody: I bought this to wear around the house since the bottoms have more grip than other slides. My feet are covered in blisters. This didn't happen with my other slides... but I have better grip on my wood floors. Disappointed in this purchase.

review.reviewBody: Nice shoes but frustrating bc the sizes across croc styles are so inconsistent. I end up ordering different sizes to see which one fits bc i don't want to miss the sale price or risk the size I need not being in stock. They should do a size chart based on other styles. (i.e. size m8/w10 but fits like a classic clog size m7/w9) I would've known to size up instead of ordering my normal size. Now I have to return the ones that don't fit.
review.name: Inconsistent Sizing - Runs small

review.reviewBody: Love the fit the style and color!! Super cute and comfortable

review.reviewBody: These are not the same as the original Echo Slides. I bought a pair a year ago that fit perfectly and were very soft. Now they're rock hard and much narrower. It's a shame because I wanted to buy more and recommend to friends and family, but now I won't because they're so uncomfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Benton Springs Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received my Columbia fleece zip-up today, and I‚Äôm honestly disappointed. The quality isn‚Äôt what it used to be. I bought the gray fleece about 1.5 years ago, and it was incredibly soft and felt high-quality. Both this one and the old one are labeled 100% polyester, but there's a noticeable difference in quality.

This is my second disappointing zip-up jacket from Columbia. I thought the first was just a fluke, but now I see a pattern. They continue to charge high prices, but the quality has significantly dropped. It is satatic-prone material is really disappointing. In the images the new jacket looks nice, but just trust me it‚Äôs not as thick as it used to be and not as cuddly, warm, soft, and overall anything it used to be. Even the zippers feel cheap now. I‚Äôm just so disappointed. üòî

For those of you that want to continue with a purchase regardless of my review/ opinion:

I am 185lbs, 5‚Äô6, longer torso, and this fit very well. I purchased and XL 

In the past I weighed 170 and the large fit perfect (but that was the old quality material) so if you‚Äôre about this weight & height I would say large should fit you well.
review.name: Quality has changed
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve. Please reach out if you need further assistance.

review.reviewBody: side pockets, color, fit, all great, worn for several trail runs and are awesome so far
review.name: Outstanding shorts w/great features

review.reviewBody:
I love these shorts. The short itself is made of a durable, comfortable material that doesn't bunch up and can take a beating against rocks and trees. Three pockets are in the back of shorts: one zipper and two stash pockets. The zipper pocket is the only one out of all the running shorts I've tried that is big enough for my phone with a case on and, once you tie the shorts tight, does not aggressively bounce the phone around. Stash pockets are okay; I pretty only use them for trash, as some items feel like they could bounce out, as the pockets have no closure mechanism. Maybe a button or elastic lip would fix this? Otherwise, the liner is fine and they fit me great. I'm about a 32" waist with long legs and got a medium.
I'd highly recommend for any type of running.
review.name: Fantastic shorts

name: Alta 5in Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: So I ordered a belt for my favorite sisters-in-law who loves 686 and really wanted the tool belt. review.reviewBody: I've read some negative reviews on this tire, but its baffling as to how. This T9 compound may not be the fastest rolling tire or the longest lasting, but my lord, these are STICKY! I replaced Maxxis Recons with these. Recons are a good tire, but I needed something much more aggressive on the trails I ride. The price was right so I bought these. Sooooo glad I did. I also love the fact that if I want something harder, I just buy the T7 or T5 in the same tread. Easy peazy.
review.name: Best aggressive tread tires I've used

review.reviewBody:
I usually ride the tires that come on my bike until they need replaced. I ride the same tires year round. It works for me.
When my Maxxis tires wore out I looked for a replacement of similar type. I saw the BUTCHER tires on sale for 39.99 which is a steep discount. The reviews were overall good so I  put them on with my Cush Core and I am really pleased after 6ish rides.
review.name: Not A Tire Geek.

review.reviewBody:
I love trying new tires and it's been a long time since I last rode a Specialized tire. Over the last year I have ridden tires from Maxxis, Vittoria, WTB, and Continental, so I can compare these to several of the best tire offerings on the market.

I mounted these tires to We Are One Union wheels using a high volume hand pump and they were the easiest tires I've ever mounted. Some of the ease of mounting might be due to the rim design but the tire also plays a part.

I was curious how these tires would stack up to my favorite tire combinations; Maxxis DHF WT EXO/MaxxGrip front, DHRII WT EXO/MaxxTerra rear (arguably the industry standard), and WTB Vigilante Light HighGrip front, WTB Trail Boss FastRolling rear (my personal favorite combo). After hitting the dirt, I can say I was very pleased with how this tire handles as a front tire. This tire rolls well considering how aggressive the tread is, and cornering grip is top notch and on par with the DHF. The new T9 rubber compound is super grippy and offers tons of traction in a variety of conditions ranging from loose of hard, rocky terrain, and wet rocks. We don't have a ton of wet roots near where I ride so I can't speak to their ability in those conditions.

Taking into consideration the price of these tires they are likely to find their way on my bike time and time again. Compared to the competition, these tires are significantly more affordable and offer equivalent amounts of performance. If you're tired of paying nearly $100 for a quality tire then look no further, these tires are the best bang for your buck.

Oh, and it's awesome that Specialized offers these in the Soil Searching tanwall option which donates money to trail building organizations.
review.name: Much better than I expected

name: Butcher Grid Trail 2Bliss T9 29in Tire

hasVariant.name: Singi Trekking Cap
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Singi Trekking Cap online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This could be good with adjustments to its design. As others have noted, a more adjustable strap would give the hat a better fit. The hat is also surprising tall so some will find it hits their ears before ‚Äúseating‚Äù all the way on the head. The hat also seems to show dirt and scuffs readily. I‚Äôve barely worn it and it has marks on the brim and cap. Maybe this is because of wax finish. Unless you try this hat on in a store and love the fit, I would skip this hat. In my opinion it‚Äôs not worth the price.
review.name: Needs to be revised

review.reviewBody: I would give it 5 stars but it does not really fit me right. The back strap only has 2 snaps for adjustment. On the first setting the hat is too large. On the second one it is too small. There needs to be at least one setting in between. I am actually going to remove the snaps completely and install a Velcro strap that I can adjust just right. I wish I did not have to alter a brand new hat and that it would have come with better adjustment options.
review.name: Good hat, limited adjustment options

review.reviewBody: Love the way it looks and feels (well made) only gripe is there being two sizing settings . In a future release I believe many customers would benefit with a strap as oppose to a clasp (more adjustability in sizing)
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Love this little cap. Sizing is tricky but once I returned the medium and got the small it fits perfect. Love the neutral color. Please offer the same in bright colors as well. Perfect for bad hair days and sunny days, and travel‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.
review.name: Great looking hat!

review.reviewBody: Took a while to make it's way to me but worth it. Nice cap but could do with an adjustable clasp as just two settings. Expensive too. Think it can be made water resistant with wax.
review.name: Great looking cap

review.reviewBody: Great hat - that is very well made and good looking.  Be warned though - there are only 2 settings for adjustment - so if you fall between these then be prepared for a tight/loose fit.  The next iteration definitely needs a more refined way of adjusting the fit.
review.name: Great Hat

review.reviewBody:
I really like this cap - I bought two already, in olive and in dark blue, and have just ordered a third, in black. It is finely made. The shape covers my head well, especially in the back, and it holds its shape, including the visor. Fading has been minimal. My only concern is the back adjustment. For a more formal, fitted look I have avoided the baseball-type cap with the semi-circular cut-out and the adjustment strap. This cap has two snaps 28mm apart, and no cut-out. If the tighter one is chosen, the back of the cap bunches up terribly. Better to measure your head carefully and order the correct size, as you will not like tightening it up.

     I too bristled when I noticed the Chinese origin of this Swedish cap with the exotic name. It has long been customary to fabricate in a country with the lowest labor costs, which evolves over the years. I do wish that all the internet sellers would show the country of origin, and not simply say "imported" - we are not standing in a store with the item in hand.

     Lastly, look closely at the widely varying number of millimeters between the sizes in that pop-up. Backcountry could not explain this puzzle, and it remains so a year later. I had to ask the representative to measure the inside circumference of the band to avoid a mistake.
review.name: Fjallhaven Singi Trekking Cap

review.reviewBody: Love the lightness of this cap. Adds practically no weight when packing.  Gives you all the protection you need from sun. Short brim gives unobstructed view when scrambling up rocks  in the Shenandoah?s.
review.name: Great hat

name: Singi Trekking Cap

review.reviewBody: Great features.  I fit in a 47 Shimano in past, but needed 48 in these.   Mountain Gear made exchange easy!  Thanks
review.name: Great Shoes.  A little smaller for same

review.reviewBody:
My old shimano shoes are falling apart 
Approximately 25 years old 
The new shoes are true to size comfortable 
The boa lacing system works great 
I really like the sole stiffness for long rides and rough trails
I would buy them again
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody:
Price seemed high but I tried them and they are AWESOME great fit no blisters easy on and off my feet stay dry in these.
I rode 45 mobile first day I had them.
If you love biking the you will LOVE THESE!
review.name: Don‚Äôt let the price run you off GREAT RI

review.reviewBody: Like it says in the title, the red looks spectacular and the shoes seem well-made. Unfortunately, either there's a variation between the left shoe (fits fine) and the right shoe (tight in the toe box both in width and in height) or between my left and right foot. Sizes and widths vary for me brand to brand (I typically wear 11 wide for Merrells and needed a 45 wide for my Sidi cycling shoes) but my last pair of Shimano MTB shoes were a 45 normal and if anything, they're a tad too large. If I remove the insert from these, the shoe fits almost perfectly, but I lose the arch support. I guess I'll try them in a 45 wide in plain, old, boring black.
review.name: Great color, solid shoe, but‚Ä¶

review.reviewBody: I use these for BMX racing. They feel very solid and secure on the feet/pedals. The BOA system is great to clamp everything down. The insole is comfortable, which is worth noting since I've bought other cycling shoes by other brands where that wasn't the case (and had to buy different insoles for comfort). Width was a touch tight upon arrival, but after a couple rides everything formed well around my foot. Overall, very psyched with these shoes.
review.name: Solid Shoes for BMX Racing

review.reviewBody: this mid tier 702 seems to have the same BOA system and fit as the top line, but for two hundred less.  fit is good. my feet are just a bit wider than most.  I sized up a half cm.  also this is the good type of BOA locks.  they fully release when you pull the top.  east to get out.  some brands (splzd) use BOAs that just ratchet backwards, so it takes heeps of time to loosen the cables to get out.
review.name: nice for the price

review.reviewBody: I wear a 44 in pretty much everything, so I got a 44.  Pretty true to size, maybe a bit more narrow and a bit more long than some 44s, but nothing that would make me say that they run small or big.  The fit is almost perfect.  A roomy toe box that you can close up as much as you want.  I was thinking that I finally found a new show for MTB and gravel.  But then I tightened them down, and you have to tighten them fully to get the top strap to make contact.  I have a high/big instep, so I avoided the XC701 that people were saying the top strap cut into there instep, top area. The 702 is changed slightly to make it softer on the tongue and top strap, but for me at least the problem is still there.  The shoe otherwise fits so well that I was tempted to just ride it and hope it somehow breaks in, but I think that would just be wishful thinking.
review.name: Close but nope.

name: XC702 Cycling Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Coho 5mm Skewer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Love my trailer. It's great for fishing along trails, since with the single wheel, I can go on single track trails to the rivers edge. The axle is strong and sturdy. My only wish is that the axle could somehow a quick disconnect. I do have to carry a couple of tools to remove it when I travel and need to fix a flat.
The one wheel trailer takes a little getting use to handling when you are stopped. But moving, it's awesome!
review.name: Burley Coho Trailer and axle

review.reviewBody:
Got the pannier rack and the fatter tire. Took it on the Resurrection trail with 35 lbs or so. Really feel it on the climbs, flats and downhills are a breeze. Piled wood on it well over the sides, no problem. 
Great product, but climbing off-road trails with a load is a challenging prospect. Otherwise is loaded easy, carried a ton of gear and was a fairly cushy ride. 
This is made for backcountry adventure and we plan on testing it's limits...
review.name: Burley Coho XC

review.reviewBody: Skewer fits my husband's Cannondale Super V. With 2 Coho trailers, it allows us to pull off 4 chairs, 2 blankets, bubbles, glow in the dark toys, cooler for food and Thermoses for drinks at outdoor concerts between his bike and my Marlin7, without having to worry about car parking for the family of 4.
review.name: Works for Coho and Super V

review.reviewBody: Skewer also worked out well too and easy to install.
review.name: Skewer required for Mtn bike quick release axle

review.reviewBody: Although I followed Burley guidelines for measuring the length of my rear hub, the 5mm/170 mm skewer was too long for my hub. I took it to a machine shop where 1.5 cent. of threading was added to the skewr. Only then was I able to secure my back wheel & thus hitch my trailer. Not the delay I wanted, but seems to be working fine now.
review.name: Although I followed Burley guidelines

review.reviewBody: Works fine. Fits on the fat bike with greater width. Easy to hook up trailer.
review.name: Works fine. Fits on the

name: Coho 5mm Skewer

review.reviewBody: Plan on mounting them with tele bindings and using the for uphill travel on occasion
review.name: Excited to try them out

review.reviewBody: 2nd pair of BD's and I love their products. I got the 186CM and it handles everything I have thrown at it so far. Powder, trees, fresh on top of crust, you name it and it takes it all in. They are a bit heavy for very long tours, but on the plus side they don't get tossed around in variable conditions. Well done Black Diamond!
review.name: Very versatile!

review.reviewBody: Love these new skis. I have tested them in cascade powder and spring snow. They are awesome.
review.name: Ski purchase

review.reviewBody: Great skis. should have tried a shorter ski for a work ski. Still great performance.
review.name: Impulse 104

review.reviewBody:
I usually ski 95-98 width. But this year I wanted to try something different. 

No disappointed, I can tell you that, 104 is super smooth through powder and moguls, has a lot pop and flexibility when you need it. Rips through groomers like carving ski. An ultimate choice for all around skis. 

Only one thing needs improvement is the top material, it comes off pretty easy
review.name: Love these bad boys.

review.reviewBody: Best skis I have ever tried. Lively, forgiving, nice prive & value...what more could anyone ask?! Great in POW, crud, even in a few moguls! These are the last skis I will ever own; zero reservations or regrets.
review.name: Wow!

review.reviewBody: Super Stoked to have thesse in the quiver as my daily drivers!
review.name: Daily Drivers

review.reviewBody: Good weight for jump turning in couloirs. Very playful ski. The only downside is a little soft for going real fast.
review.name: Responsive ski

review.reviewBody: Paired them with the Viptec bindings and they're awesome!
review.name: Great Skis

review.reviewBody: I bought 104 Impulse skis with fritschi tectonic 13 binding. The skis are solid and very predictable in variable snow. The 104 width as worked well march/April skiing in the Eastern Sierras. work very well with the glide lite skins. Would highly recommend. I am 6'2" 190lbs and use the 179cm length.
review.name: Great Skis

name: Impulse 104 Ski - 2024

review.reviewBody:
Overall length is measured to the wheel base. BUT the bag is almost an inch shorter,  Fully expanded I question whether it will hold 55 liters.

The internal handle liner is flimsy, especially near the zip closure.  Likewise the thin rubber external tie downs,  I found the zipper 'sticky' and balky to close,

A plus are the removable wheels using an Allen wrench.  This has been a weak point on two Eaglecreek pieces I owned. To replace cracked wheels I had to ship the luggage back at my own expense.  Now owners should be able receive new wheels and do their own replacment.

Luggage fabric looks reasonably durable.
review.name: Details matter

name: Gear Warrior XE 4 Wheeled Carry-On

review.reviewBody: I‚Äôm 6‚Äô2‚Äù and 220lbs. I‚Äôm not a small guy. XL in everything I wear. Bought an XL and it fit like a tent. GiGANtic! Voluminous. So I returned it and ordered both an L and M. The large fit, but the hood is still really baggy (to fit over a helmet). M was too small (chest), but the sleeve length was ok. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Haven‚Äôt tested it on a snowy/rainy day yet, so maybe I‚Äôll follow up later.
review.name: Sizing is REALLY big.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this before a trip out to Whistler 2 weeks ago. I wanted a shell jacket so I could layer up according to conditions, versus a one type (heavily insulated) jacket. Whistler weather had it all in the week I was there; 50mph winds; rain at the base; snow every day.  The Black Diamond jacket has right amount of inside and outside pockets, the extra length keeps the snow out and the Gortex fabric and water proof zipper keeps the water out. 
My two pet peeves:
1) the rugged, waterproof zipper takes some getting used to. Its not the easiest to operate (but maybe that means it will last longer).
2) I wish the sleeve ends had mitt "cords" to attached easily to gloves/mitts. Having to buy after market bands that go around the wrist, get tangled up with trying to fit gloves over.

For the price, a great quality and simple shell jacket that should last.
review.name: Simple yet high quality shell jacket

review.reviewBody: runs large. im 6'1, 150lbs. needed to exchange for a small. baggy around the chest area, sleeves too long. amazing set of features otherwise with a nice, clean look.
review.name: Runs large, great features otherwise.

review.reviewBody: if you typically wear size medium for jackets then get this in small. It runs big and long. Other than that this coat is great. Great material. Bright distinct color. Alot of pockets.
review.name: Great material, but runs big.

review.reviewBody: Lost the wrist gaiters compared to last model which were super nice for under cuff gloves. Otherwise seems well built and light. Has a goofy double zipper like you can zip it up in two seperate places one leaves a mesh vent if you zip the other it's fully sealed. Time will tell if this is nice to have or a gimmick. Really like the pocket on the front on both sides above the hip compared to just the one side. The inside access pocket from the outside opens up to the wrong side (right) for most chest pockets which are on the left on many mid layers... neck zip is still tight with a helmet on when zipped all the way up like the last model.
review.name: Compared to last gen

name: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Jacket - Men's
