hasVariant.description: Buy the Chaco Z/Cloud 2 Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love Chacos, but since my last pair lasted so long, I forgot that they run large. I ordered my normal size 9 and took them on vacation and they caused a lot of pain because they were too large. I re-ordered a size 8 and hoping they will be the good old sandals I‚Äôm used to!
review.name: Great shoes‚Ä¶but check the sizing!

review.reviewBody: Putting the sandals on is not nearly as easy as my earlier rendition. The cloth straps take some effort to fit the foot, and the addition of a toe strap is a nuisance, both for ease of entry and comfort.
review.name: Disappointing
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Z/Cloud this time and the single instead of the double strap. Overall, the sandals were comfortable, though strap adjustments were needed as I walked.
review.name: Comfortable sandals
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Like the color, and very comfortable when walking! Adjusting the strap was easy.
review.name: Classy Look!
comment: Thanks for sharing your experience Katherine!

review.reviewBody: My husband is in love with his Chacos, so I thought I'd give them a try. These are super cute. The footbed was very comfortable, and I can see why he loves them. The adjustible strap was good, and I was able to get a secure but not pinchy fit. They were narrower than some other sandals; I usually wear a wide width in closed shoes but medium/normal width in sandals. In the medium width, these were too narrow for me. I decided not to exchange for a wide though because the top strap that comes across the mid-foot above the arch was uncomfortable for me. I had tried on my husband's larger pair before ordering and thought I would be able to get over this feature (across the foot straps are generally not comfy for me), but alas it was not meant to be. I think that if you don't mind a top strap, these would be great for you.
review.name: Good build, but not for me
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Love the sandals. Very comfortable and supportive. I do wish the back strap was adjustable too.
review.name: Love the sandal
comment: Thanks Jess! We're happy you love them!

review.reviewBody:
I've been with Chaco since day 1, and love all of the options they currently have available. However, these still take a little getting used to, because the straps are thinner, length of sandal is a touch shorter (so my arch hits in a different spot than my OGs), and the overall fit just feeeeels different. Wish there was an "old school" throwback pair Chaco would make. I know cost is an issue, but honestly, a throwback pair might fly off the shelves for all of us hoping for no change, lol. Chaco- please give the people what they want!! 

As for the design of this particular pair- pictures don't do them justice! There are little light blue ovals surrounding the tan ovals/diamonds, really cute, gives dimension! Look great on tanned feet ;)
review.name: adjustment...!
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback.

review.reviewBody: Love these. Very comfortable. I have used them on hikes in the mountains, on the beach, and everyday wear. Excellent quality as always.
review.name: Universal sandal.

review.reviewBody: It took a few days to break in the toe straps so they wouldn‚Äôt rub and hurt in between my toes even after adjusting the straps. Now they are super comfortable and I wear them everywhere.
review.name: Comfy once they are broken in

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and supportive. Love how you can customize the strap fit. Getting lots of compliments on the cute pattern.
review.name: Love my new Chacos!

review.reviewBody: wish i‚Äôd bought this a year ago, fit is terrific on my small head and i love the helmet. Obviously you hope you never really need it, but I went with the best available
review.name: Great fit!  light and easy

review.reviewBody:
This helmet is fine. For me, it fits much worse than the Prevail II which already was a more oval shape. For the Prevail III, I had to size up. As a result, the big helmet loos is less than ideal with a ton of empty space at the front and back of the helmet.

The prevail II held sunglasses well in the lowest vent holes. The only way I can get sunglasses to fit snugly is to put them in vents further up and with the support structure parts, is hard to get in level.
review.name: Good for oval heads, bad for sunnies

review.reviewBody: I tried the Trek starves, Trek Rally, POC Ventral air mips, and Giro Aries spherical helmets.  The only one that didn't give me a headache and discomfort was this Specialized S-Works Prevail 3 Mips.  I can wear it for long rides with zero discomfort.  I am very happy.  I do wish it came with a fidlock clasp.  My Oakley Sutro's do fit in upside down but are a bit loose and can not be inserted all the way.  The Giro and POC were better at storing glasses.
review.name: Best option for oval headshape

review.reviewBody: Happy solo ride!
review.name: Best helmet ever!

review.reviewBody: Been using former models of the prevail helmets for a decade and I am very happy with Prevail 3.
review.name: Prevail 3 - a great helmet

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The internal pocket layout, laptop sleeve and overall design are great. Very well thought-out functionality and ergonomics, as to be expected from Osprey. The width and padding on the carry strap is comfy and stable, and the bag seems like a very durable construction. Small detail, but I also appreciate the metal closure hooks for the main compartment, rather than loud / hard-to-operate buckles.

3 stars due to a few complaints (some also pointed out in other reviews):

- Would be nice to have the padded portion of the carry strap adjustable for where it sits on the strap. This bag carries nicely in riding position, with the bag high on the back. But if you are also airport commuting or just walking between meetings, etc, it can be nice to simply sling the bag over your shoulder and not necessarily be in "commute mode".

- For someone with a bigger frame, there is not enough adjustability in the stabilizer cross-body strap to get it down low-enough on the chest. It sits pretty high where it leaves the main strap, even at the bottom of it's adjustability range, such that it is located up towards the left armpit rather than on the side of the body. Would be great to just have another 1-2 inches of travel downward for the location of this strap.

- As others have mentioned, what the heck is the purpose of the metal piece on the end of the strap?? Just seems to swing around and get in the way. Maybe I can open a beer with it? Lots of other beer-opening tools out there, and overall seems somewhat useless, so I will try to remove this myself.

Any consideration of making this from waterproof materials, rather than requiring a separate rain cover?
review.name: The internal pocket layout, laptop

review.reviewBody: I wish this awesome bag had a shoulder strap that could be hung the other way. I am left handed and wear my satchels over my right shoulder and sitting at my left hip. This bag is designed for people that wear it the other way, rendering most of the strap options useless for me. Very sad at this design.
review.name: So sad.

name: Metron 18L Messenger Bag
